website_summaries.verdict: This model is a good option for users who require the bandwidth for most commonplace internet activities, but who typicaly use no more than two or three devices.
pros: Streamlined connection is preferable for those who use few devices
Helps find the best location for optimal coverage
Offers range that covers all spots of average-sized homes
As with other D-Link models, the push button set up is a nice feature
cons: Because of the single channel, this may not be the best option for families who tend to use multiple devices at once

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer  -- for two days, or even a few weeks!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Works well for both AC and N. Signal strength indicator is useful. Web interface is sensible. Connection is stable -- unlike my experience with a comparable Netgear device. (This review is of the DAP-1620.) Update: After two days of working well, the unit failed. After reset, could not connect to Web interface to attempt to reconfigure. Exchanging for another of the same, figuring that it's a quality control issue rather than the fundamental design being bad. Update two: The replacement unit has now failed.
customer_reviews.author: whit

customer_reviews.title: Worked awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge house that was hardwired with Network cabling in nearly every room, but because it was so big, the wifi signal was none existent at the other end of the house or on the other floor. We plugged this into the network at that end of the house on the other floor and it worked awesome. No more wifi dead spots in the house. It was also extremely easy to get set up. Never had to call tech support because the setup was exactly like the instructions said.
customer_reviews.author: M Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Link on config card shows "404 Not Found"
customer_reviews.text: Setup was just as easy as our DAP-1325. It connected within a minute. The 5GHz wifi is so much faster than the 2.4GHz. Perfect for my laptop and Xbox One. Only problem I have with it is that when I enter the link on the configuration card it gives me a 404 error message. I checked multiple times if I write it correctly and I did but the wifi works regardless so there's no real need for me to configure it.
customer_reviews.author: Madi Schwemer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the older AP I was using. This is hardwired into my network and rebroadcasts in a part of the house where the 5Ghz and even the 2.4Ghz signal is low from the main router. Very easy to setup and the firmware will even update automatically instead of having to dig around the manufacturer's website and 'hope' you grab the right version so you don't brick it. Great feature that they added!
customer_reviews.author: mkztg

customer_reviews.title: Works well, although reboots every once-in-a-while.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an ethernet bridge for my desktop computer, and have not really tested the repeater functions. It works well generally, with good speeds. There are, however, two issues I have come across. The first is that you can not turn off the repeater function if you use it as a bridge. The second is that it reboots itself about once a week, and is offline for about a minute. Overall, not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WorldView

customer_reviews.title: Great Extender
customer_reviews.text: I used this device to extend my router signal to reach a bathroom floor thermostat that is Wifi enabled. I tried for days trying to get my bathroom thermostat recognizing my home Wifi with intermittent success. One I plugged this baby in, the bathroom floor thermostat has worked ever since. I did try to use this extender and the LAN port to stream My TIVO to my TIVO Mini -- however this experience was not as good as the bathroom one.
customer_reviews.author: Rim

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Xtender
customer_reviews.text: Connected to network just fine. Now In my garage & shed I can get a better signal from home network.!
customer_reviews.author: Doug  M.

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless extender I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for my grandmother and this product was priced well and worked way better then I ever expected. Never had a wireless extender that even remotely worked well, but this one did.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Harriman

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Would recommend but for me my at&t sucks so if the incoming signal is bad this can't help. But it is a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg McKendall Jr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Fastest peripheral I ever installed. Took 2 minutes. Plugged it in to the wall outlet, pressed the button on this unit and my wifi router and DONE. Bars on my laptop went from 1 bar to 5 which is maximum. Works perfect. No drop outs or dead zones, Rapid delivery added to it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet port works wonders
customer_reviews.text: Got it to help cameras especially one in particular that was in a bad zone. Well I can sync the cameras to it but its not strong enough for even one, BUT I ran a 50 foot ethernet cord from the bad spotted camera and into the extender and it works great sitting in my outside closet going through quite a few walls. No more drops on the camera anyways.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My Nintendo Switch has a hard time getting any signal, super easy set up and the internet is much faster on the switch. I don’t think I would rely on this as my go to for my iPhone unless I’m in the backyard. I did notice a 1 ms ping increase and my download speed dropped from 230Mbps to 40Mbps Overall, it solves the WiFi problem with the switch. Increased its download speed from 1mbps to 30mbps
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried WiFi extenders before but didn't work as expected... although having 40MBps when close to my main router, connection through the extender gave me only 5MBps or less in the remote location. With this device wired to the main router, I get the 40MBps in the remote location. Works really great! Plus it is compact, non-intrusive...
customer_reviews.author: JORGE GUZMAN

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the situation
customer_reviews.text: My new gigabit router has to be in my living room, and my desktop computer is in my bedroom. I wanted to see if an extender would help the signal better reach my bedroom. It did not. In fact it was less. So although the extender was a functional device, I returned it because it did not help my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Susan MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: Took a little bit to set up but works good. I have 5 bars all over the house ...
customer_reviews.text: Took a little bit to set up but works good. I have 5 bars all over the house and outside the home. Using it as an AP w/Ethernet connected
customer_reviews.author: Ni Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Extend your WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty much right out of the box. I would recommend not naming it the same as your normal wifi SSID name. Could not verify which device I was actually connecting two. Naming it something else allows you to verify your Network. Bought for the sole purpose of extending my wifi so I could use wifi calling on my phone. Not exactly sure if it helped. But I do show a connection.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Connects easy if you have WPS
customer_reviews.text: Connects easy if you have WPS. More modern modems/routers will. I can only say it works, but would not recommend this as a dependable solution. My extender is about 20 feet from my main wireless access point. When I get 20 feet away from the extender, thus 40 feet from my wireless access point, the signal strength of the two are equal, so it is not so powerful! Also, though it does fill my otherwise weak signal spots with a strong access signal, the speed is almost unusably slow. Mine is solving somewhat of a problem now, but will not get another.
customer_reviews.author: JavaJoeMorgan

customer_reviews.title: Great extender!
customer_reviews.text: INCREDIBLE system. I am glad I contacted the manufacturer PRIOR to purchase, I would have purchased an incorrect extender for my Modem! Thank you! ! ! RECOMMEND HIGHLY!
customer_reviews.author: Man from Minnesota - a purchasing agent & reviewer!

customer_reviews.title: The signal meter is helpful in finding the optimum location for the best signal.
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 of these to extend a wireless network about 200 feet beyond the router. 1 of them connects to the router with a 50 foot Ethernet cable and the other one is wireless another 150 feet away. The signal meter is helpful in finding the optimum location for the best signal.
customer_reviews.author: salukidude

customer_reviews.title: Used in a sealed or re-sealed Box?
customer_reviews.text: I think it was used as opposed to a new item.. Why? Because upon activating it I was searching for Dlink for Wifi... Instead wifi was named Roger-Bell ... Funny if Dlink made a mistake in doing that. Dont deceive your buyers into thinking that its new.. and for one I don't know it its a damaged unit, it keeps on disconnecting. Will just return it...waste of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Vinci R.

customer_reviews.title: meh! don't bother
customer_reviews.text: got this to add to the router we bought of same brand that was not getting the job done. Neither of them worth the time it took to get here. Should send them back and should have read the reviews because we are having the same issues everyone else has had with both these produccts.
customer_reviews.author: dianejmac

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One would not even connect to my router, even when plugged into the same outlet. The second one worked for about two days, then it lost connection and no matter what I did, could not get it to reconnect again, or if it did, it only had connected with one bar (out of 3) and devices would not connect through it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This was EASY to set up with our Comcast/Xfinity modem/router, and in five minutes it was helping our WiFi get around a tricky corner that used to fade the signal to the point of total dropouts. I'm very pleased with the simplicity of setup and the benefits it is providing for our particular home layout.
customer_reviews.author: Longrower

customer_reviews.title: I spent 6 hours working with three techs trying unsuccessfully ...
customer_reviews.text: I spent 6 hours working with three techs trying unsuccessfully to hook up another brand that was highly rated. The D-Link hook up took, I am not kidding, one minute. Press WPS button on the router and then press WPS on the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Harry W. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Easy, not that easy
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I did not give it 5 stars because it is not as easy as just plugging it in. I had to set it up through the computer, which honestly was pretty easy and I am not that smart. They should have just said to do it that way instead of it's as easy as plugging it into the wall and push two buttons.
customer_reviews.author: scot mangold

customer_reviews.title: D-Link AC1200 Wi-Fi Range Extender (DAP-1620)
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be a range extender, it received a strong signal from my router, but did not transmit as strong a signal and there was no noticeable increase in usable area :(
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Good product and AMAZING PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Works as described best part is the amazing amazing price
customer_reviews.author: Mp

customer_reviews.title: ... to set up a wired AP and it worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I knew to look up instructions to set up a wired AP and it worked like a charm. Now I have great wireless to all of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell D

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality.  Second unit kept shutting down and powering up every few seconds
customer_reviews.text: THis was the second unit I ordered after the first worked so well. Unfortunately, this unit cycled on/off every few seconds. I just returned it and bought another brand,
customer_reviews.author: zoro_bawa

customer_reviews.title: but i have to say i was disappointed. i would shop around
customer_reviews.text: weird, i have a lesser model provided by my alarm company to extend the range of their camera, so i purchased this model which is a model up. i have to say, it doesn't extend as long as the lower model. i'll double check the model number and update this post, but i have to say i was disappointed. i would shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Just Cav

customer_reviews.title: transmits a very low signal. If I put it ...
customer_reviews.text: transmits a very low signal. If I put it half way between the laptop and the router, the signal from the router is stronger than from the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Renata S.

customer_reviews.title: works great the speed is just slightly slower
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my Dlink 868L to extend my 5G, works great the speed is just slightly slower..from 95 Mbps to 72-85 Mbps. The setup was easy once I modify my access list and added the DAP-1620's MAC address, (i use MAC address control to access my network). I would like 2 options for extending my network instead of 1 only. Also I would like to be able to change the network settings, (DNS), I don't know how or can't change the setting-they are assigned from my router. But for me the extension of speed was most important, I work from Home, use Amazon Prime and Netflix, and have teenagers... not issues.
customer_reviews.author: PLM

customer_reviews.title: Didn't increase signal strength AT ALL.
customer_reviews.text: I tried several positions for this. None of them increased the signal AT ALL to a room 1 floor and 2 rooms away. Of course it's an old house with pretty solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Conner

customer_reviews.title: Not good for signal extending
customer_reviews.text: Signal received and transmitted is very weak, doesn't extend far. Current router has better signal then this repeater in places needing it.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Hussein

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Has worked for several weeks without a lag in my net speeds. Boosts my signal so I can shop on Amazon from my bed! Woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and (so far) does what it ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and (so far) does what it says it will - extend my wifi signal. One trap to avoid for beginners is to note that this model has the US power adapter - so I had to buy a converter for Australian power points /plugs. Would've been nice to have that feature more clearly pointed out
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work at all.
customer_reviews.text: i couldn't get this thing to hook up with the modem at all. therefore it became useless.
customer_reviews.author: MIckey Gunns

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, works perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect out of the box, easy WPS setup,. Even extended my 5G enough so I can use it thoughout the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: John Buyea

customer_reviews.title: Not that much difference
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, not the greatest help in gaining range, I don't think anyway. Maybe there is something I am missing, but it's not like WOW what a difference. Would have returned it but it's too much trouble. It's up and running but wasting electricity plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: dgw

customer_reviews.title: The unit works fine with the visible SSID network
customer_reviews.text: Immediately having issues related to manually connecting to a network with a hidden SSID in a repeater mode. I've updated the firmware and reset it to factory on 3 separate occasions. I cannot find anything specific online in regards to resolving this issue. The unit works fine with the visible SSID network.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Expectations under average level
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit with the hope to correct some blind wifi spots at my home. But, the signal is constantly dropping by itself and never pass a range of 200 mbps, even when it says can reach an average speed of 350 mbps. Sorry, but is not what I was thinking of it...
customer_reviews.author: cval129

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to do, but occasionally ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do, but occasionally it'll just power cycle itself and takes a few minutes to reboot. Also randomly the speed throughput isn't as fast as my actual router.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSteel

customer_reviews.title: Works but didn't meet my purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Works but didn't meet my purpose. Thought I could use as a wifi to Wan bridge - does not work as a bridge
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Stegman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have not been able to consistently link with my router yet. Does not want to stay linked.
customer_reviews.author: Ron D

customer_reviews.title: Using as a wired AP
customer_reviews.text: Using this DAP as a wired access point rather than a Range Extender. Works as expected with no real issues. Will likely pick up a couple more in the near future. Good, cost effective to solution to my WiFi coverage challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bisaillon

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Like this product very much. Don't like the fact, maybe my ignorance, that it has different log in names and password settings from the sending router.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: working ok
customer_reviews.text: its working ok. not boosting significant. also dropping net speed.
customer_reviews.author: nkj2079

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a big difference in parts of the house where my laptop would drop signal. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Enzone

customer_reviews.title: Not much different
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this one. I expected something better however the signal is not much different. I tried everything on the support link but it does not improve anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But it if you feel like power cycling it everyday
customer_reviews.text: It loses connection every day and I have to power cycle it. Probably one of the worst tech purchases I have made in decades.
customer_reviews.author: mchwang

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Kept dropping WIFI signal when it was less than20 feet from router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Better than my router I think
customer_reviews.text: No instructions but figured it out. Works great. Better than my router I think.
customer_reviews.author: Hector C.

customer_reviews.title: On and off.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Seems to lose connection a lot. Other than that when it works, it works good.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: user-friendly and very reliable...works like a charm...just plug and play..
customer_reviews.author: GeraldJames

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and seller
customer_reviews.text: Terrible signal when I was working and didn’t work 90% of the time. Completely stopped working after a month and a half and seller would not provide a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, works well and we need it with ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product ,works well and we need it with satellite internet !
customer_reviews.author: Moir Rickey Young

customer_reviews.title: Phone home?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this is doing its job. Have to reset is a pain. 🤔
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t work and the company only gives you a month to return it otherwise you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Parsons

customer_reviews.title: No added value!
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi coverage is very bad and signal is even weaker than my WiFi router. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money.
customer_reviews.text: Tried this as a wireless access point. Will not hold a signal for more than 5 minutes. Range is about 30 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: It made my internet connection much better upstairs in my home in the most economical way!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous J

customer_reviews.title: Device not reliable
customer_reviews.text: The device gets too hot and stops working, I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Caffnioly Meneses

customer_reviews.title: Dont by
customer_reviews.text: Does not work tryed two would not connect to wifi
customer_reviews.author: Parker H.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Never could figure out how to make it come on and work.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: works as intended... good value... better than running new wires and outlets etc... not perfect but really close
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does allow the extension of multiple network names for the frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: The extended WiFi range offered by this product is extremely limited. Very disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Airmaint

customer_reviews.title: No extednded range here.
customer_reviews.text: This connected to my router with no problem but the extender had to be placed within about 12 feet of my D-Link dir-615 router for it to register anything but an amber (no good) connection. There was absolutely no increase in WI-Fi range in my home so I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: docgobbler

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It didn't serve the purpose so I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Nafi

customer_reviews.title: It would not link with my ATT Uverse provided router ...
customer_reviews.text: It would not link with my ATT Uverse provided router. I even tried to hard wire connect it with an ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: KIRSTIN PIRKL

product_meta.title: D-Link AC1200 Wi-Fi Range Extender (DAP-1620)
product_meta.description: With a compact design and wireless speeds of up to 1200Mbps, the DAP-1620 will let you enjoy a fast wireless connection. You can extend your wireless network using Wi-Fi or using an Ethernet cable. Dual-band technology helps reduce interference from nearby wireless transmitters in the home. Really fast wireless transfer rates for all of your web browsing, HD media streaming, and gaming needs.
feature_bullets: Extend the coverage of your home's existing wireless network at faster speeds
Helps find the best location for optimal coverage
Ideal for homes that are pre wired for Ethernet and for extended wireless coverage
Easily access all features through the new user interface
Fast wired connections No additional power cables required
Refer to the PDF attached below in Technical Specification for User Manual

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars253 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
